en: Jesus used the image of a shepherd to describe himself.
His words caused both reflection and division.

lines: Jesus said,
“I am the good shepherd;
I know my sheep
and my sheep know me—
just as the Father knows me
and I know the Father—
and I lay down my life for the sheep.”
“I have other sheep
that are not of this sheep pen.
I must bring them also.
They too will listen to my voice,
and there shall be one flock
and one shepherd.”
“The reason my Father loves me
is that I lay down my life—
only to take it up again.
No one takes it from me,
but I lay it down of my own accord.
I have authority to lay it down
and authority to take it up again.
This command I received from my Father.”
At these words the people were divided.
Some said,
“He is demon-possessed and raving mad.
Why listen to him?”
But others said,
“These are not the sayings of a man possessed by a demon.
Can a demon open the eyes of the blind?”

question.en: What stands out to you about how Jesus describes himself—and why do you think people were divided?
